text: Velleia macrophylla, or large-leaved Velleia, is a perennial herb in the family Goodeniaceae, which is endemic to Western Australia. It grows on moist sites in Beard's South-west province. It flowers from October to December or January. The species was first described as Euthales macrophylla by John Lindley in 1840. The species was redescribed by George Bentham in 1868 as Velleia macrophylla. == References == == External links == * The Australasian Virtual Herbarium – Occurrence data for Velleia macrophylla. macrophylla Category:Flora of Western Australia Category:Taxa named by George Bentham Category:Plants described in 1840
title: Velleia macrophylla
